steps.title: â€œDeluluâ€ can describe a person with unrealistic expectations.
steps.content: â€œDeluluâ€ can describe a person with unrealistic expectations. Itâ€™s not strange to see the word â€œdeluluâ€ used in a romantic/dating vein, often as a way to poke fun at people who believe they have a deep romantic connection with someone for a mundane reason. [1] X Research source According to Lizarraga, "Being â€˜deluluâ€™ over another person in a romantic sense, means that someone is foolishly optimistic about a love interest, especially when the infatuation is clearly one sided. It is a play on the word delusional to poke fun at someone who is clearly aiming for someone out of their league." "He totally ghosted me, but Iâ€™m going to remain delulu until he comes crawling back. â€œI came home after our first date and told my roommates that they were going to be my future spouse. I'm so delulu.â€ â€œHe totally ghosted me, and yet I still think he's going to come crawling back and ask me to be his girlfriend. Delulu behavior!â€ â€œHe literally told me that he cheated on all of his ex girlfriends, and I thought he'd be loyal to me. I was really in my peak delulu era!â€ â€œHe asked her what the homework was last night, and now she thinks theyâ€™re dating. Sheâ€™s so deluluâ€¦â€ â€œThis is getting pretty delulu, dude. You triple-texted him a week ago and he left you on readâ€¦â€ â€œWhack me over the head if I ever start acting this delulu LOLâ€

steps.title: â€œDeluluâ€ often describes delusional fan behavior.
steps.content: â€œDeluluâ€ often describes delusional fan behavior. Youâ€™ve probably seen it before: a fan who thinks they have a special connection with a celebrity for a nonsensical reason (like making eye contact during a concert), or someone who goes off the handle whenever someone criticizes their favorite star. The word â€œdeluluâ€ is a handy way to describe these unrealistic mindsets. [2] X Research source Lizarraga says, "It's not uncommon for fans to trick themselves into thinking that their relationship to these public figures is more personal than it actually is. So to poke fun at this â€˜fan behavior,â€™ the term mocks those who believe they have a closer relationship to these public figures than they actually do." â€œCall me delulu, but when Harry Styles blew a kiss into the crowd, I swear it was for me!â€ â€œI saw the most delulu comment on Taylor Swiftâ€™s Instagram yesterdayâ€¦â€ â€œI swear, some K-Pop stans are so deluluâ€¦ imagine harassing other people over a guy who doesnâ€™t know you exist ğŸ˜­â€ â€œThat one celeb had to break up with his partner because his fans were too delulu ğŸ˜“â€

steps.title: â€œDeluluâ€ can also be a mentality of self-positivity and self-confidence.
steps.content: â€œDeluluâ€ can also be a mentality of self-positivity and self-confidence. For some people, being â€œdeluluâ€ is a fun, cheeky way to believe in themselves, even if the odds arenâ€™t necessarily in their favor. [3] X Research source The start of delulu being used as a positive affirmation can arguably be credited to TikTok user biancaxb08, who coined the now famous phrase â€œbeing delulu is the soluluâ€ (being delusional is the solution). [4] X Research source Lizarrago explains, "As high achievers with ambitious goals may seem 'delusional' at the beginning about where their life is headed, many persist in the vision and 'delusion' until their goals manifest. When a person refers to themselves as delulu, it describes their unwavering faith in themselves and their potential, but also signals a level of self-awareness that they may come across as overly ambitious." For example, â€œMy goal in life is to be a singer, and I will remain delulu until Iâ€™m selling out arenas.â€

steps.title: Call out bizarre behavior with the word â€œdelulu.â€
steps.content: Call out bizarre behavior with the word â€œdelulu.â€ Chances are, youâ€™ll stumble across your fair share of delulu behavior, both in your real life and your digital one. Feel free to text a friend if you witness someone being delulu, or leave a comment calling out delulu behavior. [5] X Research source â€œStop being so delulu, bro. You know sheâ€™s married and has kids, right? ğŸ’€â€ â€œTheyâ€™re delulu. They seriously need to touch some grassâ€¦â€ â€œLook at this tweet I found. Some people are seriously delulu itâ€™s actually insaneâ€¦â€ Note: It might be better to comment on/criticize â€œdeluluâ€ behavior in a private setting, rather than engaging with someone publicly.

steps.title: Embrace the â€œdeluluâ€ mentality to reach greater heights in your own life.
steps.content: Embrace the â€œdeluluâ€ mentality to reach greater heights in your own life. Applying for a school that feels a little out of your league, or angling for that promotion? Channel some â€œdeluluâ€ energy as you dare to believe in yourself and what youâ€™re capable of. [6] X Research source Being â€œdeluluâ€ and putting yourself out there more can open the door for new opportunities. It can also be a helpful way to silence your unproductive doubts and concerns. Embracing a more â€œdeluluâ€ attitude can make it easier to view your future through a more positive lens, along with other productive habits like practicing gratitude and saying positive affirmations .

steps.title: â€œDeluluâ€ was first used by a critical fan on a K-Pop forum in 2014.
steps.content: â€œDeluluâ€ was first used by a critical fan on a K-Pop forum in 2014. On April 6, 2014, a OneHallyu (a now-defunct K-Pop forum) user coined the term â€œdeluluâ€ to refer to K-Pop fans speculating on the relationship status of 2 K-Pop figures. From there, the word â€œdeluluâ€ spread to other corners of the internet and social media, like TikTok. [7] X Research source

steps.title: "Delulu" is only the tip of the iceberg when it comes to Gen-Z slang.
steps.content: "Delulu" is only the tip of the iceberg when it comes to Gen-Z slang. Check out these other popular Gen-Z slang phrases and what they mean: Stand on business : Stand by what you've said in the past and "take care of business" Pop off : Celebrate someone for something they said or accomplished (also used: "go off") Periodt : Said to add emphasis to something you've said Say less : "I understand" or "I agree with you" Slay : "You're doing great" or "You look amazing" Do it for the plot : Do it for the drama or excitement, even if it could have a negative outcome Ate and left no crumbs : You crushed it It's giving : Say "It's giving ___" to describe something's vibe or energy My Roman Empire : Something I think about daily
